revised_title: Magnetic Survey of the North Polar Regions and its Implications
tldr: The author presents the Magnetic Survey of the North Polar Regions, conducted between 1840 and 1845, and compares it with the Magnetic Survey of the South Polar Regions. The study aims to understand the changes in the Earth's magnetic field and their implications on various latitudes. The author also discusses the challenges in determining the magnetic force and the corrections needed for secular change.
